content: cabot by sharon spence copyright © 2025 sharon spence a 2-color striped hat that knits up like magic finished size 22 materials 1 skein garage dyeworks auto worsted in basic black color a 1 skein garage dyeworks auto worsted in laurie s cauldron color b or 2 skeins worsted weight yarn in contrasting colors needles us 6 circular needles 16-inch us 7 circular needles 16-inch plus 1 set double pointed needles size 7 notions stitch marker pom pom if desired special techniques jogless stripes in the round* brooklyn tweed has a great video using slipped stitches https //www youtube com/watch v=c7qrehyud-k&t=364s changing colors on each round pick up the new color from beneath so that the yarns twist with smaller needles and color a cast on 100 stitches place marker and join to knit in the round work k1 p1 rib for 2 change to larger circular needle and knit 1 round join color b and knit 1 round do not cut a *be sure to work the jogless stripes in the round technique on each round otherwise your stripes won t line up and you will end up with a line of uneven rounds at the back of your hat round 1 with a knit around round 2 with b knit around repeat rounds 1 and 2 until work measures about 6 ½ inches begin decreases continuing to alternate colors decrease round 1 *k8 k2tog* around decrease round 2 knit decrease round 3 *k7 k2tog* around copyright © 2025 sharon spence decrease round 4 knit decrease round 5 *k6 k2tog* around decrease round 6 knit continue working decreases as established on every other round changing to dpn when necessary after working *k1 k2tog* around *k2tog* on next round cut yarn leaving a tail thread yarn needle draw through remaining stitches twice fasten_off copyright © 2025 sharon spence
